snippet: Tony Tjan, chief executive and a founder of Cue Ball, a venture capital firm in Boston, suggests waiting before criticizing someone else’s new idea.
abstract: Adam Bryant Corner Office column features Tony Tjan, chief executive and co-founder of venture capital firm Cue Ball, who discusses his career and management style.
lead_paragraph: Tony Tjan, chief executive and a founder of Cue Ball, a venture capital firm in Boston, suggests waiting before criticizing someone else’s new idea.

headline.print_headline: A Good Mentor Never Tramples On Big Dreams
headline.seo: Tony Tjan of Cue Ball, on Accepting New Ideas
headline.main: A Good Mentor Never Tramples on Big Dreams
